definition: to cancel (a booking)/to unsubscribe (from a newsletter etc)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: Last year CNN said it was dropping Reuters’ wire service.
sentences.chinese: 去年，CNN宣稱退訂路透社的資訊服務。

sentences.english: You can leverage technology to include a preference center driven unsubscribe link.
sentences.chinese: 你可以啓用技術，在郵件中加入一個退訂鏈接。

sentences.english: Unsubscribe to newsletters or magazines that you don't read.
sentences.chinese: 退訂不讀的傳報或雜誌。

sentences.english: We will use this subscription reference later to unsubscribe from the broker.
sentences.chinese: 我們將稍後使用此訂閱引用來從代理退訂。

sentences.english: Be sure to always include a way for people to unsubscribe in all your email campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 確保所有的營銷郵件中包含退訂的方法。

sentences.english: Enter your email address to unsubscribe from the NeochaEDGE newsletter.
sentences.chinese: 輸入您的郵件地址以便退訂新茶鋒潮簡報。

definition: to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
to return a product for another item
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
